page.title: 08BUS CAR OR TRAIN
page.content: Brunel first thought of a railway to Kingsbridge in 1836.The line ran through Loddiswell,opened in 1893 and closed in 1963.All that is left of the trainline are some cuttings,an old tunne and a few stations(now houses). A lot of people remebered the trains and thought it was bad when they stopped. Some said they would like it to be re-used like the one at Dart Valley but it probably won't be. There used to be buses running around a lot of the roads in this area.Today the buses only go on the main roads to Plymouth and Totnes (3 per week). Most people use cars to get around in and nearly all the people wa asked said they couldn't live in this area without one.There is a Mini bus that goes around the villages for those who can't use a car like the elderly.It is called the{Coleridge Bus.}
